Description: Body sherd of Attic black-figured pottery olpe; exterior: part of left-hand vertical border of figured panel, with two incised spoked rosettes with added red on alternate petals and opposed chevrons, framed by dilute lines(single on left, double on right); in (and overlapping) panel, black-figure decoration consisting of fingers and thumb of a horizontal hand.
Producer name: Attributed to a Follower of: The Gorgon Painter
Excavator/field collector: Excavated by: Dr David George Hogarth
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Ashmolean Museum, Oxford. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Bibliographic references: Venit 1982 / Painted Pottery from the Greek Mainland found in Egypt, 640-450 BC (p. 303, no. B304)
Möller 2000 / Naukratis, Trade in Archaic Greece (p. 223, no. 7)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.0295) (Phase 1)
CVA Oxford II / Corpus Vasorum Antiquorum Great Britain 9 Oxford fasicule 2 (p. 92, pl. I, no. 29)
Previous owner: Currently owned by: Ashmolean Museum, University of Oxford
